meanings.definition: A person who rebels against authority or control.
meanings.sent1: The revolters demanded more freedom from the strict rules.
meanings.sent2: The group of revolters gathered to protest the new laws.
meanings.sent3: The revolters decided to have a peaceful rebellion by refusing to follow the unjust orders.
meanings.sent4: The revolters were like a storm brewing, ready to challenge the status quo.
meanings.sent5: The image of the revolters standing up for their rights stayed in everyone's minds.

meanings.definition: A group of people who rise in opposition or armed resistance against an established government or ruler.
meanings.sent1: The revolters marched through the streets, demanding change.
meanings.sent2: The country was in chaos as revolters clashed with the authorities.
meanings.sent3: The revolters' rebellion had a touch of humor when they used water guns in their protest.
meanings.sent4: The revolters' defiance was a beacon of hope for those seeking freedom.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the revolters facing the armed forces was a powerful symbol of resistance.
